definition: lit. pull one hair and the whole body moves/fig. a slight change will affect everything else/the butterfly effect
pinyin: qian1 yi1 fa4 er2 dong4 quan2 shen1

definition: to lead along/to pull (an animal on a tether)/(bound form) to involve/to draw in
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb
body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158

sentences.english: Pull one hair and move watch one spot all over and see whole picture.
sentences.chinese: 牽一髮而動全身觀一斑而見全豹。

definition: variant of 戰略伙伴|战略伙伴[zhan4 lu:e4 huo3 ban4]
(jocularly) public building that has been lying idle (and is thus ideal for housing mosquitos) (Tw)
(of friends or partners) to share both the honor and the disgrace (idiom)
Haimen county level city in Nantong 南通[Nan2 tong1], Jiangsu
(idiom) to use methods appropriate to the current situation
